runs.comm: chopped back to Ramdin. Narine starts with an inswinger outside off, Perera looks to cut but the ball comes bak in
pushed with the angle towards mid-on for a single
some swing for SN. Inswinger but goes down leg, wide called
slower offspinner now, plenty of variation on show. Dilshan inside-edges to fine leg
the offspinner again, outside off and Perera rock back to punch to long-off with the turn
just a little bit of swing, but lots of width and Dilshan crisply threads the gap at point for four. Cut that ball relatively late to get the gap, good batting
offspinner on off, TD hangs back and drills to long-on with the spin
full on leg and clattered through midwicket for two, the slow outfield does some able fielding for WI. Whipped off his pads after advancing and dragging from off stump
swipe! Fullish length on off, Dilshan stays in his crease and looks to heave it over midwicket but the ball doesn't come on as well as he liked, inside-edged
full outside off, drilled to mid-off with no feet movement
swivel-pulled to fine leg, shortish length on leg, Kp stays in his crease and lets the abll come to him before unfurling a heavy pull towards that man at fine leg
back of a length on middle, worked to fine leg off the front foot
fullish length on middle, pushed to mid-on with soft hands for a quick single
just a short-arm jab. Wow. Good length on middle, not even that short. Perera picks the length quickly, stays back and pulls powerfully past midwicket
absolutely terrific. Full and wide outside off, Perera stands and delivers. No feet movement. Uppish drive evades cover and into the boundary. Runs coming freely for these two yet again
full and a wide yorker, Perera looks to slice this through but is beaten
powerful drive. Nice timing too but doesn't find the gap. A bit too full is Taylor and KP leant into that drive but straight at mid-off

poor shot now. Drags that to mid-on. Full and wide outside off, Perera looks to hit this down the ground but takes it towards mid-on instead and the crowd goes silent again. Just the wicket WI needed.
fuller than a god length but considerably wide outside off, Shehan badly mis-times a drive to cover. No feet movement whatsoever.
very poor delivery, Rampaul's struggles continue. Full down leg, would have been called wide if he left that alone but Dilshan flicks this wide off square leg for a couple
better. Full on middle, may have been the slower delivery. Dilshan pushes this towards mid-on and calls for the run immediately
back of a length outside off, guided towards point off the back foot
nice yorker, the events of the first innings have carried on to the second which is nice to see. Yorker on middle, SJ steers this towards point and is looking for one but is sent abck

124 ks, a definite slower ball outside off, SJ tries to dab to third man but there is no pace on that. Jayasuriya steers this to the keeper, he wants the single but doesn't realise Ramdin's throw is already in. Misses the stumps though, would have been out with a direct hit
flat-batted to cover. Good come back in that over from Ravi
short ball and punished. Picked the length so early and got in position too very quickly. Rolls his wrists on that and keeps it down, finds the gap at backward square. All this to a 140 ks delivery.
slower ball now on off, pushed towards midwicket for a quick run
fullish length on middle, 141 ks. he wants that single to get off the mark but he has pushed the ball too close to the fielder and the experienced TD sends him back
slower ball outside off but a bit too wide and called
nicely timed but not in the gap. Fullish and wide, beautifully timed square cut goes to backward point
he gets the runs he wanted now. Full outside off, he stays in his crease and looks to cream it, but he wanted to hit that too hard. Eventually, he squeezes this past mid-off for four
and he finds the gap through point now. He brought third man up and bowls a short ball outside off. Not great thinking, if he was. Slashed through point for four
short and wide, spins back in. TD cuts to point
a bit faster and quick through the air, driven off the back foot to long-on
nicely bowled. Full on off, calmly defended off the front foot
just a bit short outside off, cut late but straight to point
the carrom ball, comes back in on middle. SJ stays back and calmly pushes to long-on
just a bit of width but there is too much respect for Narine. Patted to cover off the back foot
starts off with a slow, short ball outside off @ 111 ks, cut to short third man where Rampaul makes a diving stop.
massive appeal, and that was close too. May have been a bat on it, yip. Big inside edge on to pad and then to short third man. Fullish length on off
slower delivery on off, pushed to long-off
overpitched outside off, but asking Dilshan to generate his own pace. Drills to cover

another slower one on off, pushed towards long-on with very soft hands and comes back for the second. Pollard runs across, and throws it to the non-strikers end, Bravo runs to the stumps from cover and acrobatically removes the bails. But a diving Jayasuriya makes it back
worked with soft hands to deep midiwicket for another brace. Terrific use of the hands
slower offcutter to start on middle from around the wicket, SJ charges at the bowler and cuts to deep cover
slow on middle and Dilshan does it again, pushes this to deep midwicket with very soft hands for a couple.
sticking to the cutters for now. Wide outside off, creamed to deep point
looking to hit it too hard at the moment. Shortish outside off, he shuffles across and looks to flat-bat it but hits back to Sammy
makes a bit of room and crisply drives to deep cover
slower ball outside off, leading edge rolls along the ground towards cover
wow, nice slower ball outside off, SJ thinks of blasting this over cover and eventually plays no shot
low full toss outside off, drilled to long-off
the faster length delivery on off, just climbs over off as Dilshan misses his attempted pull. Did not pick the quicker one
offcutter outside off, Dilshan plays a late cut to point for one
just when the pressure was telling, Jaysuriya unfurls a fierce pull over midwicket. Goes well over the square leg's head
slower one yet again outside off, SJ tries to smash this back to Pallekele but misses completely
slower delivery on off and middle, the ball strikes Dilshan on the pad and then towards cover for a leg bye
106 ks, slower offcutter outside off, elegantly driven to cover
a bit unlucky for Pollard, he deceived Jayasuriya there. Too wide though
smashed to long-off
full on leg, off the pads again towards fine leg.
powered to long-off yet again, trying to smash all balls here is Jayasuriya and is therefore unable to time it.
slower offcutter on middle, heaved to deep midwicket
full on off, pushed to long-on
tries to be cheeky now. Jayasuriya struggling. Full and wide, SJ tries to play a cute reverse sweep but doesn't get close to it. They get a bye though as Ramdin is uanble to collect cleanly
much better from Dil. Picks his gap and executes perfectly, gets under it well enough to heave it over mid-off for four.
swept off middle stump to fine leg
and four more! Jayasuriya finally finds the boundary, he smashes the full delivery back past the bowler. Did not time that well enough but it carries to the boundary
he connects on that reverse-sweep now, a lot confidence can do for a sportsman. A bit closer to off and he gets closer to it and uppishly plays this towards short third man

how dare he? What disrespect to Narine. But in actuality, that is good gap finding. Gets down and uppishly connects with the reverse sweep over point for four. Terrific shot, and his execution has been close to faultless
this is just splendid. Full on off, turned in the gap towards midwicket for another couple.
forces Narine a tad shorter and Dilshan goes back and pulls powerfully to deep midwicket
a bit leg side-ish, and a bit too full, giving SJ the chance to work this against the spin to midwicket
lots if spin for Sunil. A bit wide outside off, coming back in. Dilshan pushes to point
shortish and wide outside off, beats Jayasuriya on the cut
fullish just outside off, pushed towards mid-off for a quick single. Sammy makes a good diving stop
full and wide outside off, SJ misses. Just inside that tramline adjudges the umpire.
full and wide outside off, squeezed to point
very very slow on middle, TD waits for the ball to come to him and then waits some more and then heaves a pull to deep midwicket

what a catch that is. Andre Russell take a bow. Made it look so easy. Makes me think I could have taken that. Full and wide outside off, smashed powerfully to long-off where Russell sprints around and takes a catch diving low to his left. Amazing stuff

almost another stunner. WI turning it on. What a diving effort, this keeps getting better. Short on middle, Chandi rocks back and pulls to midwicket where Pollard is lurking, he dives full length and almost completes a one-handed stunner. Just brilliant

much easier now. Simple catch. Low full toss down leg, Chandi goes back and looks to flick this in the air past short fine leg but gets underneath it and uppishly clips this straight to backward square leg.
loose delivery, full on leg, nudged to fine leg
shortish on middle, nicely pulled to fine leg
again Dilshan's experience shows. Gets to his fifty with a biff down the ground, did not overhit that, kept his shape and punched the full toss to the long-on boundary.
they steal two. Good yorker on leg, inside-edged towards square leg and by the time Ramdin runs around and throws to the non-striker, Mathews is back for the second

what is happening? Absolutely terrific execution from Dilshan. Completely turns around, switches his bat grip and switch hits that with a lot of power through midwicket/deep cover and that was destined for six before the tallest fielder on the field, Jason Holder the substitute gets in front of the ball and holds on to a sharp chance over his head. Stunning cricket
slower on middle, turned off his legs to deep square leg
fullish slower ball at 97 ks on off, calmly driven to cover
slower delivery yet again, slapped to long-on for one
slower ball outside off, falls just short of Holder at the sweeper cover boundary. MS skews a cut in the air , probably wanted to go finer
bowled from wider off the crease, and full on off, Mathews can only find the bowler
charges down now and they get two but that is still a good over. Mathews runs down and inside-halves that towards midwicket for a brace
oh what a shot. Leant into that and timed the pants off that, cleared the cover boundary too. Big hit. Siriwardana can do no wrong. Vital six runs

and a bit of luck now, but Ramdin does well too. He gets a glove on that and keeps it down to just two. Full and wide, a thick inside edge looks like it was going to the boundary before Ramdin intervened
full toss on off, clobbered to deep midwicket
and Mathews has to go now. Beautifully picked off his legs but straight to that man at backward square leg. Huge huge wicket for WI. The dangerous Angelo walks back
high full toss and it is a no ball, they steal a bye too. Again, Ramdin does well to block it with his pad, bounced just in front of him.
connected well but straight to the fielder. Made a crunchy sound as it left the bat. Fullish on middle, smashed to deep cover
off the pad, the umpire makes the right call amid lots of pressure from Bravo's appeal. Good length on leg, MS goes to pull but misses. Strikes him on the pad on the way to the keeper
swiped away off middle to deep square leg
finds the gap at deep midwicket.  A bit of sloppy fielding from Charles as he tries to stop iut but doesn't put in a good effort. Pollard isn't impressed. The ball goes through
Ramdin at it again, saves some more runs. Full, fast and on leg, takes the pad on the way to the keeper who makes a diving half-stop

sliced to Charles who takes the catch. Full and wide, Kapugedera wanted to go over cover but again wanted to hit that too hard and the ball spoons up the sweeper cover who takes an easy catch running in.
optimistic appeal but no harm in asking. Full on leg, pitched well outside leg too. Strikes MS on the pads
slower delivery from very wide of the crease, somehow he beats the diving Pollard for a single to long-on
carrom ball outside off, cut to point

and there it is. Siriwardana has to go. Narine bowls a quicker delivery outside off, Siriwardana runs at Narine but goes straight past it. Ramdin does the rest in one motion. Is that the final nail in the coffin?
quick on off, defended towards the leg side and they decide to go for the quick single, Narine throws at the non-strikers end but misses
shortish outside off, chopped to point
very close but the impact may have been outside off. Offspinner outside off, NK gets down to sweep but misses completely. Lots of deliberation but the decision is not out
excellent spell from Narine. Full on middle, inside edge towards square leg
fast ball on middle at 132 ks, heaved away to square leg. Still no boundary
Pollard takes it. Relatively simple catch. Full on off, swiped away off the front foot to long-on where Pollard takes a sitter.
smashed to long-off. Still no boundary.
Malinga backs away and miscues a pull to long-on
and that will be another. Slower delivery outside off, Kulasekara looks to heave this over midwicket but the ball spoons up to third man off the outside edge
fuller than a good length on off. Pushed to long-on. Bravo finishes with 4 for 28
nice shot. Fullish on middle, heaved off the front foot to long-on
completely deceived. Slower delivery down leg, Malinga backs away and misses his slog. The ball sneaks past bat and pad
full toss on middle, smashed to deep midwicket
Chameera runs down the track and hoicks a length ball to midwicket
back of a length down leg, DS charges and mis-times a pull to long-on
cleaned im up off the last ball. Full and straight, Malinga backs away and misses and the T20 series is shared 1-1, WI win by 23 runs.
